Key Match Events: Washington Sundar took two wickets in the opening four balls of the Super Over
India scored 4-0 after skipper Suryakumar Yadav hit a four off the first ball of the Super Over bowled by Maheesh Theekshana
Sri Lanka collapsed from 117-2 to 137-8 in the innings
Pre-Game Insights: With the series already settled, Sri Lanka made two changes and India four, with the fit-again Shubman Gill returning and both Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant rested
India scored 137-9 after losing the toss and batting first. Rain had delayed the start of the game
Post-Match Reflections: India had already taken an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. It won the first T20 by 43 runs and the second match by seven wickets
The two teams will also play three one-day internationals, starting Friday in Colombo
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indian top-order stumbled for the first time in the series
Gill held one end together with 39 runs off 37 balls, while Sanju Samson was out for a duck again
In reply, Sri Lanka made a good start. In-form Pathum Nissanka scored 26 off 27 before he was caught off the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi (2-38)
